CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The devices are structured as As shown in Figure 5a and Table 3 , the device that blended PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio had an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.76 V , a short - circuit current ( J SC ) of 4.4 mA cm^-2 , a fill factor ( FF ) of 47.5% and a power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 1.6% .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PQCDTB |
| PC61BM |
| V OC |
| J SC |
| FF |
| PCE |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PQCDTB |
| PC61BM |

I removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name":

* "Figure 5a" (this is a figure number, not a material name)
* "Table 3" (this is a table number, not a material name)
* "V OC" (this is an abbreviation for "open-circuit voltage", not a material name)
* "J SC" (this is an abbreviation for "short-circuit current", not a material name)
* "FF" (this is an abbreviation for "fill factor", not a material name)
* "PCE" (this is an abbreviation for "power conversion efficiency", not a material name)
